snippet: The latest landmark structure to fall at the hands of the militants was a triple arch built by the Romans in the second century.
abstract: Islamic State militants deliberately destroy second-century Roman triumphal arches in Palmyra, Syria, latest of several structures in archeologically renowned city to be razed; residents, who are also enduring government airstrikes aimed at terrorists, are finding it difficult to safely flee the city.

byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad and Maher Samaan contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The latest landmark structure to fall at the hands of the militants was a triple arch built by the Romans in the second century.

headline.main: ISIS Destroys Historic Arches in Palmyra, Syria
headline.print_headline: Islamic State Destroys Ancient Arches in Syria

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
